Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.INSTRUCTIONAL DESIGNER – TEMPORARY POSITIONThe SpaceX Operations Training team is looking for a motivated and energetic Instructional Designer who wants to put their skills to use accelerating humanities journey to Mars. This position will be working with subject matter experts throughout all areas of SpaceX requiring a driven individual who is always excited to learn and tackle new challenges.RESPONSIBILITIES: Create management system super administrator, providing technical support, solving SCORM/AICC problemsPOSITION DETAILS:This is a temporary position with SpaceX, for the length of time as stated, and is subject to change with minimal notice as business needs dictate.LENGTH OF POSITION: 3 monthsLOCATION: Hawthorne, CARole requires being onsite 100%, remote work will not be consideredBASIC QUALIFICATIONS:High school diploma or equivalency certificate2+ years of experience designing and developing training curriculum2+ years of experience managing and administrating learning management systemsPREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:Bachelor's DegreeExperience managing computer-based learning management systemsExperience with design tools commonly used in a learning creation environment (MS PowerPoint, Adobe Photoshop/Illustrator, Articulate Storyline, iSpring Studio & Camtasia Studio)Ability to create live video production, audio recording and voiceoverAbility to clearly and effectively communicate in both written and oral formatsOpen collaborative style; ability to work both in a team environment and autonomously with minimal supervision or directionComfortable in environments with development can best address skill and knowledge gaps in the workforceExperience with CSS and basic website building/designADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:This is not a remote position and will require relocation if not already local to the Los Angeles/Hawthorne, CA areaMust be willing to work extended hours and/or weekends as neededCOMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:Pay range:Instructional Designer/Level I: $75,000.00 - $95,000.00/per year     Instructional Designer/Level II: $90,000.00 - $115,000.00/per year            Your actual level and base salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.Base salary is just one part of your total rewards package at SpaceX. You may also be eligible for potential discretionary bonuses. You will also receive access to comprehensive medical coverage, access to a 401(k) retirement plan, and various other discounts and perks. You will also be eligible for 10 or more paid holidays per year.     ITAR REQUIREMENTS:To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder), (iii) Refugee under 8 U.S.C. § 1157, or (iv) Asylee under 8 U.S.C. § 1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here.  SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX’s Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application/interview process should notify the Human Resources Department at (310) 363-6000.

title: Instructional Designer - Temporary Position
content:
SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.
INSTRUCTIONAL DESIGNER – TEMPORARY POSITION
The SpaceX Operations Training team is looking for a motivated and energetic Instructional Designer who wants to put their skills to use accelerating humanities journey to Mars. This position will be working with subject matter experts throughout all areas of SpaceX requiring a driven individual who is always excited to learn and tackle new challenges.
RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Create computer-based training modules
Partner directly with subject matter experts to design and develop engaging content for a variety of audiences and delivery modes (online, classroom, etc.) with clear strategies and tactics to achieve desired learning outcomes
Maintain and revise existing learning products, keeping specific audience, learning modality, and other learning considerations in mind while always looking for the most efficient way to express the desired learning objectives
Serve as project manager on multiple product development projects simultaneously with the ability to stay within timelines and budgets and rapidly adjust to changing priorities
Respond to learning help desk tickets using JIRA
Manage user roles and permissions for Learning management system
Serve as learning management system super administrator, providing technical support, solving SCORM/AICC problems

POSITION DETAILS:
This is a temporary position with SpaceX, for the length of time as stated, and is subject to change with minimal notice as business needs dictate.

LENGTH OF POSITION: 3 months
LOCATION: Hawthorne, CA
Role requires being onsite 100%, remote work will not be considered

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

High school diploma or equivalency certificate
2+ years of experience designing and developing training curriculum
2+ years of experience managing and administrating learning management systems

PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor's degree
Experience managing computer-based learning management systems
Experience with design tools commonly used in a learning creation environment (MS PowerPoint, Adobe Photoshop/Illustrator, Articulate Storyline, iSpring Studio & Camtasia Studio)
Ability to create live video production, audio recording and voiceover
Ability to clearly and effectively communicate in both written and oral formats
Open collaborative style; ability to work both in a team environment and autonomously with minimal supervision or direction
Comfortable in environments with shifting priorities
Ability to communicate professionally with all levels of management
Proficiency with MS Office products
Curiosity to understand the strategic priorities for SpaceX how learning and development can best address skill and knowledge gaps in the workforce
Experience with CSS and basic website building/design

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

This is not a remote position and will require relocation if not already local to the Los Angeles/Hawthorne, CA area
Must be willing to work extended hours and/or weekends as needed

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:
Pay range:
Instructional Designer/Level I: $75,000.00 - $95,000.00/per year     
Instructional Designer/Level II: $90,000.00 - $115,000.00/per year            
Your actual level and base salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.
Base salary is just one part of your total rewards package at SpaceX. You may also be eligible for potential discretionary bonuses. You will also receive access to comprehensive medical coverage, access to a 401(k) retirement plan, and various other discounts and perks. You will also be eligible for 10 or more paid holidays per year.     
ITAR REQUIREMENTS:

To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder), (iii) Refugee under 8 U.S.C. § 1157, or (iv) Asylee under 8 U.S.C. § 1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here.  

SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.
Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX’s Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application/interview process should notify the Human Resources Department at (310) 363-6000.

compliance.description: <p>PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.</p>

questions.description: To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about ITAR here.
